item.title: Wounded Bangladesh protesters receive robotic helping hand
item.description: Squeezing rubber-covered robotic prosthetic hands, Bangladesh protesters wounded during the deadly revolution to topple autocratic leader Sheikh Hasina test out replacement arms for their lost limbs. On Thursday he was fitted with a prosthetic limb, alongside four other students who also lost their hands during the months-long protests in which at least 700 people were killed during a police crackdown.

item.title: Russia says US using Taiwan to stir crisis in Asia
item.description: Russia accused the United States of using Taiwan to provoke a crisis in Asia. Deputy foreign minister Andrei Rudenko criticized increased US military support for Taiwan, stating it violates the 'one China' principle and aims to escalate tensions in the region to further U.S. interests.

item.title: Turkey's Erdogan to discuss Ukraine war with Nato chief
item.description: Turkish President Erdogan is set to meet with Nato Secretary General Mark Rutte to discuss the escalating Russia-Ukraine war, including concerns over Ukraine's use of long-range missiles and Russia's nuclear threats. The leaders will also address Nato defense cooperation and counter-terrorism efforts.

item.title: Trump's mass deportation plan could end up hurting economic growth
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump's stringent immigration policies, including mass deportation, could negatively impact the US economy. Sectors like agriculture and construction, heavily reliant on foreign labor, might face worker shortages and price increases. While the full extent of these policies remains uncertain, analysts predict a potential decline in GDP growth and a rise in inflation.

item.title: Trump picks attorney Brooke Rollins as US agriculture secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has selected Brooke Rollins, a longtime ally and former White House aide, to head the Department of Agriculture. Rollins, currently leading the America First Policy Institute, will succeed Tom Vilsack if confirmed by the Republican-controlled Senate. This appointment completes Trump's selection of executive branch department heads. Rollins's background includes agricultural development and experience in Texas politics.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Los Angeles assistant principal arrested for molesting 8 elementary school students
item.description: David Lane Braff Jr., a 42-year-old assistant principal and counselor, has been arrested on 17 felony counts for allegedly molesting eight elementary school students. The alleged abuse occurred between 2015 and 2019 while Braff worked as a counselor at a Santa Paula elementary school. Prosecutors say Braff molested the students, some as young as six, in his school office.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: French plastic surgeon suspended after patients claim he left them with 'potato' noses
item.description: French plastic surgeon Olivier Gerbault, known as the “nose maestro,” has been suspended for two years following accusations of botched surgeries. Multiple patients allege that Gerbault, who claimed to have pioneered a new rhinoplasty technique, left them disfigured and traumatized.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canada's military chief calls out US Senator for comments on women's role in combat: 'Can't believe we still have to justify...'
item.description: Canadian General Jennie Carignan publicly criticized US Senator Jim Risch for his outdated views on women in combat. Risch had expressed skepticism about women serving in combat roles, prompting Carignan, the first woman to lead Canada's military, to deliver a powerful rebuke.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump ally Lindsey Graham warns UK, Canada, and other countries of sanctions for aiding Netanyahu arrest: 'We should crush your economy'
item.description: UK's potential assistance in arresting Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu under an ICC warrant has drawn ire from US Senator Lindsey Graham. Graham threatens severe economic sanctions against any nation aiding the ICC, arguing it undermines US allies and risks setting a precedent for targeting American politicians.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Joe Rogan is ready to do this if Elon Musk buys MSNBC: 'I will tell...'
item.description: Elon Musk engaged in a humorous exchange with Joe Rogan on X, entertaining the idea of purchasing MSNBC. Rogan jokingly expressed interest in taking over Rachel Maddow's role, prompting a playful "deal" from Musk. The exchange followed Donald Trump Jr.'s suggestion that Musk buy the network, citing its declining ratings.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
